subject: Law
title: Children's Rights Under International Law
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Children's Rights Under International Law.

hook.text: Every nation except one has ratified the Convention on the Rights of the Child. The holdout: the United States.

buildup.text: The CRC (1989) protects children's rights to education, health, protection from abuse, and a voice in decisions.

discovery.text: The 'best interests of the child' is the guiding principleâ€”all actions affecting children must prioritize their welfare.

twist.text: The US signed but never ratified, citing concerns about sovereignty and parental rights.

climax.text: Despite near-universal ratification, child labor, trafficking, and child soldiers persist worldwide.

punchline.text: 196 nations agreed children have rights. Making it real is the unfinished work.

quiz.question: What is the guiding principle of the Convention on the Rights of the Child?
